Fast-loading test site | distinct from .top

VLSI Physical Design Lab Notes

This `.site` version uses a compact guide-and-track structure, shorter editorial copy, and minimal assets so it loads faster and does not mirror the `.top` site page-for-page.

Browse Guides Open Study Tracks

What changed

  • Different site name and metadata (`VLSI PD Lab`)
  • New information architecture (`/guides` and `/tracks`)
  • Short checklist-driven notes instead of mirrored long articles
  • Lightweight CSS and no heavy UI JavaScript

Guide Categories

9 compact notes organized for quick study sessions.

Foundations

Device behavior, modeling concepts, and vocabulary that support later implementation and timing decisions.

  • CMOS Fundamentals

Logic & Handoff

RTL-to-netlist concepts, optimization strategies, and handoff quality checks before physical design.

  • Logic Synthesis
  • Advanced Logic Synthesis

Inputs & Setup

Required files, constraints, and setup checks that reduce downstream debug noise.

  • Physical Design Inputs

Implementation Flow

Floorplan, placement, and clocking notes with a practical checklist-driven review approach.

  • Floorplanning
  • Placement
  • Clock Tree Synthesis

Lab Workspace

Case-note and reference-oriented pages kept separate from production content style.

  • Implementation Case Notes
  • Reference Index

Study Tracks

Use a sequence if you want faster progress than random browsing.

Starter Path

Quick onboarding path for learning the basic PD vocabulary and major implementation stages.

6 steps

Handoff and Optimization Path

Focus on synthesis quality and the transition from logical optimization to implementation-ready handoff.

5 steps

Lab Notes Maintenance Path

Track how the `.site` test domain documents experiments, sources, and implementation notes separately from `.top`.

2 steps

SEO Separation Note

The `.site` test domain intentionally uses a different layout, shorter copy, and different URL paths than `.top` so search engines do not see it as a mirrored version of the production site.

VLSI PD Lab is a lightweight lab-style reference for VLSI physical design learning.

Built for the `.site` test domain with different structure and metadata from the `.top` site.
